title: goxcraft
author: goxcraft
content: Anyone faced this error when connecting to TOR?QuoteComponent returned failure code: 0x804b000d (NS_ERROR_CONNECTION_REFUSED) [nsIScriptableInputStream.available]Everything was working fine. Suddenly, I got this error and was unable to connect. I tried a new identity, changed bridges, and googled the problem; nothing useful so far. Nothing seems to work. I tried TOR from my smartphone, and it works. Anyone know how to fix this? Sometimes it's so frustrating to use TOR.

comments.author: Joeyp
comments.body: Uninstall TOR browser https://tb-manual.torproject.org/uninstalling/ and then download new one, and try again.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: goxcraft on October 15, 2023, 08:26:36 AMEverything was working fine. Suddenly, I got this error and was unable to connect. I tried a new identity, changed bridges, and googled the problem; nothing useful so far. Nothing seems to work. I tried TOR from my smartphone, and it works. Anyone know how to fix this? Sometimes it's so frustrating to use TOR.I assume you are using Windows. This is because of the last Windows update, many applications are recognized as malware by Microsoft Defender. It is necessary to manually restore quarantined files in MS Defender Antivirus.Check here: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/defender-endpoint/restore-quarantined-files-microsoft-defender-antivirus?view=o365-worldwide

comments.author: goxcraft
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on October 15, 2023, 01:53:11 PMQuote from: goxcraft on October 15, 2023, 08:26:36 AMEverything was working fine. Suddenly, I got this error and was unable to connect. I tried a new identity, changed bridges, and googled the problem; nothing useful so far. Nothing seems to work. I tried TOR from my smartphone, and it works. Anyone know how to fix this? Sometimes it's so frustrating to use TOR.I assume you are using Windows. This is because of the last Windows update, many applications are recognized as malware by Microsoft Defender. It is necessary to manually restore quarantined files in MS Defender Antivirus.Check here: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/defender-endpoint/restore-quarantined-files-microsoft-defender-antivirus?view=o365-worldwideYeah, I realized that after digging some more from google. It's a Windows side problem. Specifically speaking, the latest Windows 11. Uninstalling and Installing isn't fixing the issue for me. I haven't tried the defender part, let's see if it works.One thing I couldn't understand, previously everything was fine even with the latest win 11. Now it just won't connect. Weird.
